summary: Jonnro Erasmus is a professional industrial engineer with a blend of systems engineering and business process management experience across various industries, including semi-conductors, manufacturing and power generation. He specialises in the use of models to support analysis, comprehension and communication. Jonnro’s passion and drive is to improve everything that he touches, whether it is a product, his own ability and knowledge or his personal life and relationships.

awards.title: EON Top Performer 2013
awards.description: Jonnro received an award as one of the top performers of the year.

awards.title: Engineering Departmental Award for Innovation
awards.description: The Engineering department of Eskom S.O.C. awarded Jonnro with this award for identifying the need and creating the mechanism for showing end-to-end views of how several processes interact and integrate to achieve a single objective.

projects.title: HORSE Project
projects.description: HORSE aims to bring a leap forward in the manufacturing industry proposing a new flexible model of smart factory involving collaboration of humans, robots, AGV’s (Autonomous Guided Vehicles) and machinery to realize industrial tasks in an efficient manner.

projects.title: The National Industrialisation Support Initiative
projects.description: The South African engineering and manufacturing industries drive employment and growth in the economy, but face a large industrialisation and supplier development challenge in a globally competitive and knowledge intensive market. The CSIR established the National Industrialisation Support Initiative (NISI) to enable industry participants and new entrants to deliver globally consumed products and services that are eco-friendly, regulatory compliant and sustainable, using a Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) platform. PLM streamlines the flow of multi-disciplinary information about products, services and related processes throughout a complete lifecycle, to ensure that the right information is available in the right context and at the right time.

projects.title: SIP01 Management Office
projects.description: The SIPs were initiated by the Presidential Infrastructure Coordinating Commission of South Africa to coordinate infrastructure programmes that are geographically related, inter-dependant or of the same type. SIP01 consists of the 48 programmes aimed at unlocking the northern mineral belt of South Africa and includes coal mines, power generation, transmission and distribution assets, freight and passenger railways, water pipelines, pump stations and damns, roads and urban development. The SIP01 Management Office is responsible for the monitoring, reporting and integration of those 48 programmes, by engaging and coordinating the effort of stakeholders from several state owned enterprises and government departments, including Transnet, Eskom, the Department of Water Affairs, the Department of Public Enterprises and the Deparment of Environmental Affairs.

projects.title: EON Renewable Energy Project
projects.description: The EON Renewable Energy project forms part of the company's drive to reduce it's carbon footprint and includes the design and acquisition of a small scale photovoltaic solar system.

contributors.headline: Project Leader at Boston Consulting Group (BCG)
Electrical Engineer at Triocon Consulting Engineers Centurion (Pty) Ltd

projects.title: B2B Engineering Tools Programme
projects.description: The previous initiatives of Engineering Excellence were incorporated into Eskom's Back 2 Basics campaign. This campaign is part of Eskom's drive to again be one of the top 5 power utilities in the world and aims for the standardisation, optimisation and simplification of the entire enterprise. The B2B Engineering Tools Programme brought those objectives to the Engineering Department and includes the complete overhaul of the organisation structure, key performance indicators, business processes, governance documentation and software tools. The programme also includes the reconstitution of the configuration information of many power stations, substations and transmission lines, to optimise how the newly established enterprise architecture will function.

contributors.headline: Head of Major Projects at Renewable Energy Group
Project Leader at Boston Consulting Group (BCG)
Management Consultant at Barclays Africa Group Limited

projects.title: Engineering Excellence
projects.description: To drive centralisation of its engineering talent and standardisation of practice in the newly created Technology Division of Eskom S.O.C., Engineering Excellence was initiated. This initiative included restructuring of the Engineering Department, fundamental changes to technical governance and re-engineering of several major business processes. Soon after the first set of processes were developed, the Engineering Excellence initiative was incorporated into the larger Back 2 Basics campaign of Eskom.

profile_positions.description: Jonnro is working on the implementation and adoption of model-based systems engineering across ASML. His primary concern is the use of the system model to drive improved product configuration definition and management.
profile_positions.title: System Engineer

profile_positions.description: Jonnro performed research about the integration of business processes, information systems and robotics in smart factories. Specifically, Jonnro investigated how to determine which human or robot (or combination of human and robot) is the best choice to perform a task on the factory floor. This work resulted in an information system that can be used to manage dynamic manufacturing processes populated by humans, smart robotics and other machines.
profile_positions.title: Promovendus

company.name: Council for Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR)

profile_positions.company: Council for Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR)
profile_positions.description: Jonnro focussed on directed research into the use of product lifecycle management technology can be used to enable industry collaboration and supply chain integration. This research included the domains of systems and industrial engineering, enterprise engineering and architecture, product data management and supply chain management. Jonnro also advised government departments and state owned enterprises on new product development and enterprise changes.
profile_positions.title: Senior Industrial Engineer

profile_positions.location: Thorhill Office Park 25, 90 Bekker Road, Vorna Valley
profile_positions.description: Jonnro conceived a new engineering practice for Eskom S.O.C., based on systems engineering principles. He used the power of functional architecture and models to convey a complex idea and create common understanding between engineers from power generation, transmission and distribution business areas. He was also responsible for the risk management of a portfolio of large infrastructure projects.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.location: Nampak Management Services, Athol Gardens, Sandton
profile_positions.description: Evolvement and improvement of the quality and scope of the global Nampak Enterprise Architecture. Jonnro also revamped and documented the processes deployed to maintain the knowledgebase. Microsoft Excel and Access was used extensively to collect and interpret data from various business units, update the EA knowledgebase and present reports on the architecture of Nampak. These reports became a regular input to Exco meetings and departmental budgets.
profile_positions.title: Enterprise Architect

profile_positions.description: Jonnro designed the capability for the Engineering Processes and Systems department to develop Enterprise Architecture, with a scope specifically focused on the engineering business function. He also conceived, structured, modeled and maintained the process hierarchy framework from scratch for the entire enterprise.
profile_positions.title: Engineer-in-Training

volunteer_experiences.description: Responsible for all communications and newsletters to INCOSE SA members.
